events.name: Sensor Technologies and Its Impact
events.description:
Sensor technology has the potential to improve the world through various application across medical, energy, security and safety. With the innovations and inventions in the field of sensors, what are the possibilities of translating these to real solutions that address important issues that help improve people’s lives? Join us as we address these issues with our expert panel.

6.00 pm
Registration Begins

6.30-6.45 pm
Emerging Sensor Technologies and its potential across industriesRon Cellini, Technical Member, Analog Garage

6.45-6.55 pm
Infinite Possibilities of Sensor Applications  (and Impact) in HealthcareAdrienne Mendenhall, Country Manager, Access Health Singapore

6.55-7.05 pm
Improving Security for Sensor technologyDr. Vishram Mishra, MicroSec

7.05-7.35 pm
Panel Discussion: Potential vs Reality - Harnessing the potential of Sensor Technology and translating these to impactful applications.

7.35-8.00 pm
Networking Session

events.name: Voice: the next digital disruption!
events.description:
Voice is the next major disruption in computing! Big companies like Amazon, Google, Apple and Microsoft are plowing big money into NLP and AI, making voice-activated hardware assistants like the Amazon Echo, the Google Home and more recenly the Apple HomePod (available come December). This workshop will teach you all you need to know in order to build an Amazon Alexa Skill, get it certified by Amazon and released into the wild. You can even win yourself a FREE Echo Dot from Amazon this month if you manage to successfully publishing an Alexa Skill before the end of July! Terms and conditions apply.

AGENDA

Evolution of Human-Computer Interaction
Who is Alexa and what can she do
How to create an Alexa skill
Get your skill certified and published


MEET THE PEOPLE



Cjin Pheow Lee
Adjunct Lecturer - Institute of Systems Science, NUS
Speaker




Prasanna Veerapandi
Assistant Lecturer - Institute of Systems Science, NUS
Speaker


REQUIREMENTS


Participants to bring own laptop
Laptop should be ready for development in Node.js (v6.x): https://nodejs.org/
Sign up for Amazon Developer account at https://developer.amazon.com/
Sign up for AWS Lambda service at https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/

RESERVING A SEAT

Enter the promotional code that accompanies the invitation email sent to you to reserve a seat. Limited seats available. Hurry!

events.name: Windows UG & .NET - July
events.description: 7:00 PM Title: Modernize your meetings with Skype Room System V2 on Windows 10 Speaker: Brennon Kwok, MVP Office Servers and Services Synopsis: Learn more about Skype Room Systems v2, Microsoft's latest conferencing solution designed to transform meeting rooms into a rich, collaborative Skype for Business experience. See the end-user and IT administrators features  of the new UWP Skype Meeting app running on Windows 10. Skype Room Systems v2 is designed to leverage existing equipment like LCD panels for ease of installation to bring Skype for Business into meeting rooms 8:15 pm Title: .NET standard 2.0 & .NET core 2.0 Speaker: Senthamil Selvan Synopsis: There are .NET standard, XAML standard, .NET core, Asp.NET core and UWP. There are many of the terms confusing the developer which one to adopt. Attend this session to get it clarified on what those keywords really are and when to choose which framework for your business.
events.location: Microsoft Singpaore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorum, Singapore 018989
